Title: The effect of digital capability on competitiveness through digital innovation of e-travel business in Indonesia
Source title: Proceedings of 2020 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2020
Affiliations: BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Management Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Hartono, H., BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Management Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Halim, E., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The growth of the internet in the world globally, including Indonesia, has had a significant impact on digital business and also digital media. In the era of Industry Revolution, 4.0, which is shown by automatization or also known as the Internet of Things, has had a significant impact on economic growth and, of course, every industry of businesses including e-travel business. This research uses associative research with a quantitative approach. The data sources used in this study are primary data sources in the form of information from the parties concerned and secondary data in books, journals, and government reports. Data collection techniques used were questionnaires, interviews, and documents. Datasets taken in this study were 125 of E-travel business companies in DKI Jakarta Province (Indonesia), which are using electronics or technology in their business operations. Data were taken at the end of the year 2019 using purposive sampling and use Path Analysis with Smart PLS 3.0 as a statistic tool. There are four hypotheses with three variables in this research: Digital Capability, Competitiveness, and Digital Innovation. The results of this study indicate that Digital Capability through digital innovation has a significant effect on Competitiveness. The study objective is determining the effect of Digital Capability on Competitiveness through Digital Innovation in e-travel business in Indonesia due to facing Industry Revolution 4.0. © 2020 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Competitiveness; Digital capability; Digital innovation; E-travel business
Index Keywords: Digital storage; Electronics industry; Information management; Regression analysis; Surveys; Tourism industry; Business companies; Business operation; Digital business; Digital innovations; Economic growths; Government reports; Primary data source; Quantitative approach; Competition

Authors: Halim E., Hebrard M., Hartono H., Halim K.O., Russel W.
Title: Exploration WordPress as E-commerce RAD-CMS for SMEs in Indonesia
Source title: Proceedings of 2020 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2020
Affiliations: School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Phoenix Legal Research Center, Sanya, China; BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Management Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Halim, E., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Hebrard, M., Phoenix Legal Research Center, Sanya, China; Hartono, H., BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Management Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Halim, K.O., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Russel, W., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: This research is motivated by the need to build a website for SMEs to build an e-commerce website along with the increase of internet users in Indonesia and increase online stores and online shopping consumers in Indonesia. Content Management Systems (CMS) with Rapid Application Development (RAD) help SMEs (Small Medium Enterprises) to build an e-commerce website in a short time. This research is preliminary research on serial research. This research's method is Exploratory Research with Systematics Literature Review, Focus Group Discussion (FGD), and Interview. Primary data of SLR use Mendeley as a tool and FGD taken from the WordPress communities' developer in Indonesia in March and May 2020 involving 41 of WordPress Developers from Jakarta, Bogor, Tangerang, Bekasi, Semarang, Solo, Riau, and Jambi, and all are cities in Indonesia. The purpose of this research is to: explore the CMS-based E-commerce website building using WordPress problems in Indonesia, explore the main themes and plug-in to develop e-commerce based on WordPress, and explore skill or knowledge needed to make a prototype of some e-commerce website using WordPress for further research. © 2020 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Content management System; E-commerce; Rapid application developer; Wordpress
Index Keywords: Information management; Websites; Content management system; E-commerce websites; Exploratory research; Internet users; Literature reviews; Online shopping; Rapid application development; Small medium enterprise; Electronic commerce

Authors: Kartono R., Sasmoko, Indrianti Y., Lasmy, Hartono H.
Title: Managerial efforts in building organization behaviour (study of Entrepreneurs in Indonesia)
Source title: Pertanika Journal of Social Sciences and Humanities
Affiliations: Department of Management, BINUS Business School, Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta Barat, 11480, Indonesia; Faculty of Humaniora, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta Barat, 11480, Indonesia; Research Interest Group in Educational Technology, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta Barat, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Kartono, R., Department of Management, BINUS Business School, Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta Barat, 11480, Indonesia; Sasmoko, Faculty of Humaniora, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta Barat, 11480, Indonesia, Research Interest Group in Educational Technology, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta Barat, 11480, Indonesia; Indrianti, Y., Research Interest Group in Educational Technology, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta Barat, 11480, Indonesia; Lasmy, Department of Management, BINUS Business School, Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta Barat, 11480, Indonesia; Hartono, H., Department of Management, BINUS Business School, Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta Barat, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The aim of this paper is to examine the relationship between self-confidence, hope, optimism, and resilience as managerial efforts in building organization behaviour in Indonesia's entrepreneurs. Major research questions pursued are what is the influence of managerial effects in building organizational behaviour? What is the most significant variable in building organizational behaviour in Indonesia's entrepreneurs? The research was conducted from a sample of 148 entrepreneurs in Indonesia. The result of this research verified managerial efforts had a negative influence on building organizational behaviour of Indonesia's entrepreneurs, and self-confidence was the most significant variable in building the organizational behaviour of Indonesia's entrepreneurs. © Universiti Putra Malaysia Press
Author Keywords: Entrepreneurs; Hope; Managerial effects; Optimism; Organizational behaviour; Resilience; Self-confidence
Funding Text 1: The authors thank the entrepreneurs who took part in the online questionnaires and Bina Nusantara University for providing funds and full support for the accomplishment of this research paper.

Authors: Hartono H., Jehezkiel E., Firmansyah R.
Title: The influence of product innovation on helmet industrial competitiveness with standardization sni as a moderated variable
Source title: International Journal of Scientific and Technology Research
Affiliations: BINUS Business School Undergraduate, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Management Department, BINUS Business School, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Hartono, H., BINUS Business School Undergraduate, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Jehezkiel, E., Management Department, BINUS Business School, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Firmansyah, R., Management Department, BINUS Business School, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The objective of the study is to analyze the competition of the helmet industry in Indonesia by examining whether Product Innovation can influence the national helmet industry competition with applying Standardization SNI. This research is descriptive and associative methodology at all company that produce helmet in Indonesia. Data collection was done through literature study, interview and questionnaire. The analysis tool used is linear hierarchical model with SPSS version 22. The result showed Product Innovation has an influence on the competitiveness of the national helmet industry. Product Innovation will not improve competitiveness while Standardization SNI as a moderating variable influences negatively. SNI Standard should be more relied on industries condition and the market need, so SNI seems not be a solution to the industry to get competitiveness. © IJSTR 2019.
Author Keywords: Competitiveness; Linear hierarchical model; Product innovation; Standardization SNI

Title: A Study on Competitiveness of ICT Adoption and Entrepreneurship Orientation on SMEs in Indonesia
Source title: Proceedings of 2019 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2019
Affiliations: Management Department, Undergraduate Program Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Hartono, H., Management Department, Undergraduate Program Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Herman, R.T., Management Department, Undergraduate Program Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Lasmy, Management Department, Undergraduate Program Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The increasing number of SMEs in Indonesia has become the government's attention that determines the effect of the ICT Adoption and Entrepreneurial Orientation to SMEs Competitiveness. The purpose of this research is to examine the relationship of the ICT Adoption, Entrepreneurial Orientation and SME's Competitiveness in Indonesia. The method used is quantitative method by data collection using questionnaire distribution to several SMEs from various business sectors. Data processes using multiple regression analysis performed using the SPSS version 2. Data collected using questionnaire distributed to SME's owners that have adopted ICT and size of samples determined by Slovin technique. The result of research stated that SME facing difficulties to adopt ICT and more concerned to the sales quantities instead of product quality or market penetration, and also requires capital loan assistance to develop their businesses. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: entrepreneurship orientation; ICT adoption; SME competitiveness
Index Keywords: Information management; Regression analysis; Surveys; Business sector; Data collection; Entrepreneurial orientation; Ict adoptions; Market penetration; Multiple regression analysis; Quantitative method; SME competitiveness; Competition

Authors: Hartono H., Brodjonegoro S.S., Kuncoro E.A., Budiastuti D.
Title: Competitiveness in higher education: An empirical study in Indonesia
Source title: International Journal of Scientific and Technology Research
Affiliations: BINUS Business School, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Bandung Institute of Technology (ITB), General of Higher Education, Indonesian Science Association (AIPI), Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Hartono, H., BINUS Business School, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Brodjonegoro, S.S., Bandung Institute of Technology (ITB), General of Higher Education, Indonesian Science Association (AIPI), Indonesia; Kuncoro, E.A., BINUS Business School, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Budiastuti, D., BINUS Business School, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: The influence of globalization affects all business organizations as well as non-businesses. Moreover, Higher Education Institution (HEI) is required to consistently produce new knowledge, products, or technology, so utilization of the resources as a key factor of higher education success is a necessity. The purpose of this study is to examine the key factors of HEI competitiveness. This study argues that organizational learning with the right transformational leadership and application of knowledge management along with the ability of the organization to act entrepreneurially and to behave innovatively toachieving high performance and competitiveness. This research is descriptive and verificative with explanatory survey method at accredited private HEI in DKI Jakarta. Data collection was done through documentation study, interview and questionnaire distribution. The analysis tool used is Structural Equation Modeling-Partial Least Square (SEM-PLS) with WarpPLS version 5.0 software. The results showed that HEIs could be diagnosed, understood and changed toenhance competitiveness. This study provides evidence to guide strategy development, priority, setting and planning, especially how to develop entrepreneurship culture and enhance innovative behavior with transformational and knowledge management roles. Creating appropriate transformational leadership culture and knowledge management support organization as a learning organization to change, improve and growth. © 2019, International Journal of Scientific and Technology Research. All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: Competitiveness; Entrepreneurship; Innovative behavior; Knowledge management; Performance; Transformational leadership

Authors: Lasmy, Dewi, Syahchari D.H., Saroso H., Hartono H.
Title: Effect of market orientation, marketing capability, product innovation on performance
Source title: International Journal of Innovation, Creativity and Change
Affiliations: Management Department, BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Universitas Bina Nusantara, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Lasmy, Management Department, BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Universitas Bina Nusantara, Jakarta, Indonesia; Dewi, Management Department, BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Universitas Bina Nusantara, Jakarta, Indonesia; Syahchari, D.H., Management Department, BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Universitas Bina Nusantara, Jakarta, Indonesia; Saroso, H., Management Department, BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Universitas Bina Nusantara, Jakarta, Indonesia; Hartono, H., Management Department, BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Universitas Bina Nusantara, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: The economic crisis experienced by Indonesia in 1997, at which time the orientation of economic growth relied on the development of large businesses. Large businesses are expected to encourage the growth of micro, small and medium business. However, it turned out that the crisis had stopped the success of Indonesia's economic development, which resulted in many large businesses experiencing bankruptcy and largescale termination of employment. In contrast to large businesses, micro and small businesses recover faster from the crisis, and workers who are affected are absorbed into these micro and small businesses. Speed of recovery of micro and small businesses due to the more flexible nature of the business, relatively small capital, and generally does not depend on imported raw materials and foreign debt. Also, many micro and small businesses have sprung up and have begun to have an important role in Indonesia's national economy. In 2017, micro and small businesses made a stagnant ante to Indonesia GDP (Gross Domestic Product) of 60.34%. Therefore, it is important to maintain the stability of the performance or even improve it. The purpose of this study was to analyse the effect of market orientation, marketing capabilities, and product innovation on the performance of micro and small businesses, especially in West Jakarta. The number of samples is determined using the Slovin formula, which is 270 samples of 835 population, micro and small business people in West Jakarta City who already had a Micro Small Business License. While data collected using a questionnaire it was analysed using SPSS software. The results indicate that the most influential on the business performance is product innovation and followed by marketing capability, then the last is market orientation. © 2019, Primrose Hall Publishing Group.
Author Keywords: Business performance; Market orientation; Marketing capability; Micro and small business; Product innovation
Funding Text 1: Authors would like to thank respondent who wholeheartedly willing to fill out the questionnaire despite their busy days, support from the SMEs West Jakarta and to our university.

Authors: Herman R.T., Widiasari J., Lasmy, Hartono H.
Title: How popular culture affects brand identity and perceived quality in consumer decision making
Source title: Pertanika Journal of Social Sciences and Humanities
Affiliations: Management Program, Bina Nusantara University, Palmerah Jakarta, 114801, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Herman, R.T., Management Program, Bina Nusantara University, Palmerah Jakarta, 114801, Indonesia; Widiasari, J., Management Program, Bina Nusantara University, Palmerah Jakarta, 114801, Indonesia; Lasmy, Management Program, Bina Nusantara University, Palmerah Jakarta, 114801, Indonesia; Hartono, H., Management Program, Bina Nusantara University, Palmerah Jakarta, 114801, Indonesia
Abstract: The purpose of this study is to determine whether Perceived Quality, Brand Identity and Korean Popular Culture influence decisions on product purchases. This research used path analysis to determine the relationship among these variables. Statistical analysis shows that Product Perceived Quality has 0.741 direct contributions to Purchase Decision while Brand Identity has 0.792 direct contributions to Purchase Decision. Based on the value of R Square 0.670 Product Perceived Quality together with Brand Identity has 0.670 (67.0%) influence on Purchase Decision. Based on the results of this research, customer assessment of Product Perceived Quality, Brand Identity, Popular Culture and Purchase Decision is good. © 2016 Universiti Putra Malaysia Press.
Author Keywords: Brand identity; Korean wave; Popular culture; Product perceived quality; Purchase decision

Authors: Simamora B.H., Jerry M., Hartono H.
Title: Strategy alignment with organizational culture assessment instrument (OCAI) results of cellular industry in Indonesia
Source title: International Journal of Economics and Management
Authors with affiliations: Simamora, B.H., Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Jerry M., Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Hartono, H., Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: This study aims to identify current and preferred organizational culture in the major cellular companies operating in Indonesia so that congruent strategy could be developed accordingly. Using Quinn and Rohrbaugh (1983) competing values framework, the overall cultural profiles and dominant characteristics of the organizations was determined through a personally emailed survey employing the Organizational Culture Assessment Instrument (OCAI). Results concluded that culture at the company selluler in Indonesia is currently more on the market, although the culture of clan and the hierarchy is also naturally balanced, while the culture expected by most of the employees of the company celuller in Indonesia is the Market. These results suggest that strategy at cellular company in Indonesia that congruent with cultural style Market should be increased without leaving the culture of hierarchy within the company.
Author Keywords: competing values framework; congruent strategy; current and preferred culture; major celluler company; organizational culture assessment instrument

Authors: Kurniawan Y., Johan, Halim E., Hartono H.
Title: Knowledge management systems for Information Technology operations center
Source title: Lecture Notes in Engineering and Computer Science
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University11480, Indonesia; Management Department, School of Business Management, Bina Nusantara University11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Kurniawan, Y., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University11480, Indonesia; Johan, Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University11480, Indonesia; Halim, E., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University11480, Indonesia; Hartono, H., Management Department, School of Business Management, Bina Nusantara University11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Information Technology Operation Center (ITOC). is the one division in Information Technology Department for XYZ company. This division responsibility to maintain and improve Information Technology services and operations in XYZ company. The major problem in this company is the number of employee turnover. It is become the obstacles for the company to keep the knowledge in the company, because the majority employees are outsourced. The company need a knowledge management systems as a solution to keep the knowledge of employees in the company (capable of storing, distributing knowledge, and maintaining corporate knowledge). The system design of this paper used SECI model method by Nonaka and Takeuchi and Object Oriented Analysis and Design method.
Index Keywords: Design; Human resource management; Knowledge acquisition; Knowledge based systems; Knowledge management; Object oriented programming; Analysis; Corporate knowledge; Information technology departments; Information technology services; Knowledge management system; Object oriented analysis and design; Operations centers; System; Information management

Title: Online marketing channel in selling franchise business in Indonesia
Affiliations: School of Business Management, Universitas Bina Nusantara11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Halim, E., School of Business Management, Universitas Bina Nusantara11480, Indonesia; Hartono, H., School of Business Management, Universitas Bina Nusantara11480, Indonesia
Abstract: In Indonesia, as well as in the United States, franchise system is used as business expansion strategy for Small Medium Enterprises. In the year 2012, there are 1.700 franchise-format companies. It means that the franchise format business has significant impact to Indonesia economic. Recently, franchisors are looking the appropriate marketing channels in order to increase their number of outlets. This paper data based on a survey in Jakarta on a 3-days December 2013 Franchise and Business Opportunities Expo with 82 respondents of franchise exhibition visitors (prospective franchisees) and 27 franchise exhibitors (franchisors). Half of this exhibition was followed by some franchisors and the others exhibitors sold products non-business opportunity. By using t-test and qualitative comparison, will be compared the answer from franchisors and franchisees. The objective of this paper is to see the ways of online marketing channel offer by franchisors are absorbed or not by prospective franchisees or investors. © 2015 American Scientific Publishers. All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: Franchise; Indonesia; Marketing channel; Online marketing
References: Chen, Y.-S., Hua, G., Justis, B., (2009) Data Mining in Franchising, , IGI Global; Delone, H.W., McLean, E.R., (2003) Journal of Management Information Systems/Spring, 19, p. 9; (2014) Franchise Business Economic Outlook for 2014, , By: IHS Global Insight for IFA; Pamecha, Amit, Leveraging technology for franchise performance and growth (2008) Franchising World, 40 (8), p. 15. , Aug 2008, ProQuest Entrepreneurship; Paswan, K.A., Wittmann, C.M., Knowledge management and franchise systems (2009) Industrial Marketing Management, 38, p. 173; Roberts, Chris, (1997) Journal of Hospitality and Tourism Research, p. 21; Sukandar, Anang, (2013) Indonesia Franchise Business Growth 2013, , Indonesia Franchise Association, Jakarta, Indonesia; Yeoh, Tracy, (2009) Franchise Industry, , United States of America Department of Commerce, Malaysia; Yodle, (2013) Yodle Franchise Owner Survey Results Summary, , January 2013. Authors: Halim E., Kurniawan Y., Hartono H.
Title: Business intelligence modeling for increasing company value and competitive advantage in franchise restaurant business in Indonesia
Source title: WIT Transactions on Information and Communication Technologies
Authors with affiliations: Halim, E., Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Kurniawan, Y., Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Hartono, H., Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: The impacts of franchise business to the economy are proven globally. In order to increase the company value and to keep competitive, companies need to understand the customers and its business environment. The impact of information system is proven that gives positive impact to companies. Business intelligence (BI) in franchise companies is not a new issue, but mostly the application relates to the business as a unit of the whole company not the whole company itself. There are franchisors and franchisees to be considered in designing franchise BI model. © 2014 WIT Press.
